sentences.sContent: Chenier and the band are performing at the Silver Palace tomorrow.
sentences.sCn: 车尼尔和乐队明天将在银宫演出。

sentences.sContent: The children perform two plays each school year.
sentences.sCn: 孩子们一学年表演两部话剧。

sentences.sContent: She was fired for not performing the duties outlined in her contract.
sentences.sCn: 由于没有履行合同中规定的职责，她被解雇了。

sentences.sContent: ...in-class exams force students to learn how to perform under pressure...
...devices that might perform miracles for their child's IQ and help him win some great robotics competition but only if they are used just so...
...Tears can perform certain communicative functions which words cannot...
...there is also research that demonstrates that individuals perform worse...
...finally cleared up the confusion about why people sometimes perform better and sometimes worse in front of an audience...
...The research argued that boys often perform badly in mixed schools because they become discouraged when their female peers do better earlier in speaking and reading skills...

remMethod.val: per(每) ＋ form(形式) → 表演是将各种艺术形式综合起来 → 表演

trans.tranOther: to do something to entertain people, for example by acting a play or playing a piece of music
